Field Detail

broker_permissions

private static volatile PermissionBroker broker_permissions
Permission Broker that is returned when the getBroker() method is called. Only one instance of this Broker can exist at one time.

Constructor Detail

PermissionBroker

private PermissionBroker()
PermissionsBroker constructor

Method Detail

getBroker

public static PermissionBroker getBroker()
Returns the only instance of PermissionBroker that exists to return read-only copies of permission and permission level objects.

Actual setting of permissions require a Validation object that is determined to be acceptable or not (thrown exception if invalid) to actually set permissions. It also applies to getting permission levels, but even if permissions are returned as read-only, it's not so much a security risk.

Returns:
PermissionBroker broker for permissions

               throws DBException
Description copied from class: Broker
Removes the record from the database that is equivalent to the given object. The object to be deleted must have originally been retrieved from the database. TODO An exception will be thrown if the record to be deleted does not exist in the database.

               throws DBException
Description copied from class: Broker
Applies all changes to the updated object to its equivalent record within the database. The updated object must have originally been retrieved from the database. TODO An exception will be thrown if the record to be updated does not exist in the database.

parseResults

public PermissionLevel[] parseResults(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
Description copied from class: Broker
Parses a ResultSet returned by a select query back into cachable objects. The original search must have used a "SELECT *" so that full employee objects are in the ResultSet.

Specified by:
parseResults in class Broker<PermissionLevel>
Returns:
An array of cachable objects.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
